Tech news for your ears

Tech news, condensed, for your ears

Thousands of people listen to Charged podcast every week to get the latest technology news and why it matters – in 60 minutes or less. Hosted by Owen WIlliams and John Edgar, Charged Podcast tackles the issues worth discussing each week – but doesn't waste your time.

Mar 19, 2016

003: Algorithms shaping us

This week on Charged Podcast, John and Owen discuss Apple’s rumored migration from Amazon Web Services to Google Cloud Platform, the takeover of algorithms on our social media feeds, Playstation VR and Baidu’s self-driving cars.

Our special guest, Ryan Walsh, Partner at Floodgate Ventures and former VP product at Apple Music also joins us to give insight into how the advertising/media industry is failing online. The current state of advertising is “pretty abysmal” for news media and Ryan explains just what that means for us. Skip to 17:10 to hear from Ryan directly.

Links:

  • Playstation VR and the amazing Oculus demos
  • QZ’s amazing conversational news bot, mentioned by Ryan

If you enjoy (or hate) this podcast, we’d truly love to hear from you! Please leave us a review on iTunes, fire us a tweet on @chargedtech or an email to owen@char.gd and we’ll get back to you!

With thanks: Our amazing jingle: Mitch Anicas

Charged podcast is brought to you by

Owen Williams

Owen was previously Editor at The Next Web and now runs digital at VanMoof in Amsterdam. He created Charged newsletter, and is probably far too obsessed with keeping up with everything in tech.

John Edgar

John likes music and weird things and hot pics. He's the co-founder and ceo at Stae and the former Chief Technology Evangelist and VP, strategy at Digital Ocean. John has been in love with the internets since forever.

Don't miss an episode

“Owen does a great job of summarizing tech news highlights of the week with some personality and a little bit of serendipity."

Ryan Hoover, Product Hunt
